modules.description: This module defines a set of terminal control commands used to manipulate terminal state, such as hiding or showing the cursor, switching to and from the alternate screen, and setting timers. It works with a variant type `t` that represents individual commands or sequences of commands, including timer operations tied to a `Riot.Ref.t`. These commands are used to build terminal user interfaces that require precise control over rendering and input handling.

Handles input events and timing in interactive applications. It supports key presses (like arrow keys, space, escape), custom messages, and time-based events such as frame updates and timers. This module is useful for games or UIs where user input and real-time updates must be processed.

This module implements a minimalistic UI framework for building reactive applications with a model-view-update architecture, enabling the creation of command-line interfaces and interactive applications. It provides core functionality for defining components with event handling, state updates, and view rendering, while integrating terminal control commands for manipulating cursor visibility, screen switching, and timers via a variant type `t`. The input and timing submodule supports key presses, custom messages, and time-based events, making it suitable for games or real-time UIs. Together, these features allow developers to build responsive, text-based applications with precise control over rendering and user interaction.
